title: New: Idiot Glee – Pinkwood
content:
Idiot Glee’s 2011 debut LP Paddywhack went somewhat under the radar for most people, and rather unfairly so to tell the truth.

Whilst it perhaps felt slightly emotionally disjointed at times, it still showcased James Friley as one of the most naturally talented songwriters around. Fast forward two years, and Friley clearly hasn’t lost that ability, as demonstrated by his fantastic new track Pinkwood; a sultry, almost bluesy-R&B style number. Arguably the best track I’ve heard in the opening few weeks of this year, hopefully Pinkwood will open up the music of Idiot Glee to the audience that it so clearly deserves. (Thanks to IAmNoSuperman for the embed and MTV Hive for the premiere.)

I think I need a lover
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
